item.title: Home
item.description:
Li Xiaoqing

Researcher, Coder, Problem Solver

Hi, I am Li Xiaoqing, a AI researcher and coder who loves turning messy real-world data into useful ideas.

My work spans traditional machine learning, deep learning, and modern generative models, including large language models (LLMs), diffusion-based synthesis, knowledge-graph reasoning, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). I am broadly interested in developing intelligent systems that combine learning, reasoning, and real-world data processing to achieve robust and scalable AI capabilities.

I am also committed to transforming these techniques into practical, real-world solutions‚Äîsuch as interactive websites, data-driven applications, and end-to-end LLM pipelines that enhance automation, analysis, and decision-making.

üéì Formal Education

Sep 2018 - Jun 2022
Shenzhen University
B.Eng. in Biomedical Engineering
Aug 2022 - Jan 2024
National University of Singapore
M.Sc. in Biomedical Engineering

üíº My job experience

Jun 2024 - present
Research Associate
National University of Singapore. Singapore

Brief introduction: AI Research Engineer ‚Äì multimodal & knowledge-enhanced systems. Responsibilities: Built production-oriented Graph RAG pipelines (vector DB, chunking, embedding optimization, retrieval tuning), which improved retrieval accuracy and consistence, and enhanced structured reasoning for clinical knowledge bases. (Paper under review) Conducted research on generative AI models (diffusion models, GANs) for synthesizing medical and time-series data, with my proposed FHRDiff model achieving an overall 75.3% performance improvement over prior state-of-the-art methods. Paper published Developed an automated OCR pipeline for extracting blood pressure monitor readings, reducing manual transcription workload and significantly improving clinical data digitization efficiency. Utilized Weights & Biases for experiment tracking and model evaluation, improving reproducibility and reducing debugging/training iteration time. Curated and preprocessed multimodal datasets (text, image, signal, and knowledge-graph data), enabling cleaner data pipelines and reducing preprocessing effort for downstream ML/LLM workflows.
Jun 2023 - Dec 2023
Data Scientist - Intern
National University Health System. Singapore

Brief introduction: Deep learning research engineer ‚Äì medical diagnostics. Responsibilities: Contributed to multiple AI and computer vision projects for medical diagnostics, improving classification and segmentation performance by 5% through model refinement and data-quality improvements. Trained, fine-tuned, and evaluated deep learning models including U-Net, YOLOv5, ResNet, and diffusion transformers, achieving measurable gains in accuracy and robustness through systematic augmentation, hyperparameter optimization, and cross-validation. Collaborated using Git and Git Flow for version control and experiment tracking, improving code reproducibility and team development efficiency in agile project settings.
Mar 2021 - Sep 2021
R&D Systems Engineer - Intern
EDAN Instruments, Inc. . Shenzhen, China

Brief introduction: Embedded system development and functional testing for dedical devices. Responsibilities: Designed and implemented embedded software for a simulator using C language and STM32 microcontrollers, enabling automated functional testing and improving test efficiency. Evaluated functional and business requirements for multiple medical device lines (patient monitors, ECG, OB/GYN, etc.), designed comprehensive test cases, and performed functional verification using both manual and automated testing frameworks.
2019 - 2021
Research Associate - Intern
Shanghai Jiao Tong University. Shanghai, China

Brief introduction: I participated in the project ‚ÄùEffect of Nutritional Status of Pregnant Women on Fetal Health‚Äù, and I collected data and preprocessed the samples to ensure the data reliability and integrity of the follow-up clinical trails, which is essential to the project. Responsibilities: Participated in the project ‚ÄúEffect of Nutritional Status of Pregnant Women on Fetal Health‚Äù. Communicated with doctors and target pregnant women in hospital, requested their consent to provide data for the project to ensure the data reliability and integrity of the following-up clinical trails. Completed the collection of data and pre-preprocessed samples via centrifugation and separation. Designed a questionnaire survey and completed data analysis with SPSS and Matlab software. Wrote academic paper (Building the Internet of Things platform for smart maternal healthcare services with wearable devices and cloud computing), and published in a high-quality journal as the first author.

Experience

I work on ML research, LLM pipelines, and system development, with experience turning algorithms into practical tools for real-world use.

Please click on each experience to view more details!
